summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from June 2011, primarily involving Jeffrey Epstein discussing potential travel plans to the Caribbean. The emails show coordination for a trip, mention bringing someone referred to as 'JL', and include a confidentiality footer claiming attorney-client privilege for Epstein's communications.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Email correspondent and apparent trip organizer
persons.context: The primary sender and recipient in the email chain, discussing travel to the Caribbean, inviting others, and the communications are marked as his confidential property.

events.title: Planned Caribbean trip departure
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein mentions flying to the Caribbean on Sunday morning.

events.title: Potential trip departure with guest
events.description: Epstein suggests someone could come on Friday with him and fly back on their own.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was actively planning a trip to the Caribbean in June 2011.
The emails reference meeting and potentially bringing an individual referred to as 'JL'.
The communications include a stringent confidentiality footer claiming they may be attorney-client privileged and are the property of Jeffrey Epstein.
The document shows Epstein using a BlackBerry from T-Mobile for these communications.
